fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

As an admin, I want to see the default issue types and workflow when creating a new project 

h3. Suggested Solution

On the 'Choose a template' page, display the issue types created by the template and display the workflow like JIRA previously did before changing to the new experience

h3. Why this is important

The information available now may be helpful in deciding whether I should create a Service Desk vs an Agile vs a Core project, but is not at all helpful in deciding which template to use.
fields.summary: As an admin, I want to see the default issue types and workflow when creating a new project

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Certain words are breaking the JQL when using the CONTAINS (~) operator
Using two reserved words together will break the search as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have an existing filter, or new query using the CONTAINS operator *~* more than once: i.e. {{field ~ <value 1> AND field ~ <value 2> AND field ~ <value 3>}}

h3. Expected Results
- The query returns the results successfully.

h3. Actual Results
If you have an existing filter, you may get a 500 error with the following exception:
{code}
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Unable to transform boolean query to SQL predicate: ''
at com.atlassian.jira.jql.dbquery.LuceneQueryToTsQueryTransformer.lambda$null$0(LuceneQueryToTsQueryTransformer.java:46) [classes/:?]
at java.util.Optional.orElseThrow(Optional.java:290) [?:1.8.0_131]
at com.atlassian.jira.jql.dbquery.LuceneQueryToTsQueryTransformer.lambda$transformInternal$1(LuceneQueryToTsQueryTransformer.java:46) [classes/:?]
at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$3$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:193) [?:1.8.0_131]
at java.util.stream.ReferencePipeline$2$1.accept(ReferencePipeline.java:175) [?:1.8.0_131]
at java.util.Spliterators$ArraySpliterator.forEachRemaining(Spliterators.java:948) [?:1.8.0_131]
at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.copyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:481) [?:1.8.0_131]
at java.util.stream.AbstractPipeline.wrapAndCopyInto(AbstractPipeline.java:471) [?:1.8.0_131]
at java.util.stream.ReduceOps$ReduceOp.evaluateSequential(ReduceOps.java:708) [?:1.8.0_131]
{code}

h3. Notes
- There are certain words when used together break the search.
For instance, if you use \{\{text ~. AND text ~ NA}} the query will break.
- Outside the reserved words, here are some of the terms that breaking the search.
Note the list is not definitive:
{noformat}
text ~.
text ~ "a" (applicable to any single letter)
text ~ "will"
text ~ "no"
text ~ NA
{noformat}
- This will also affect gadgets that are using broken filters as well.

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Certain words are breaking the JQL when using the CONTAINS (~) operator

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When you edit the link name of "Cloners", the default clone link, if you try to clone an issue you'll get an error informing that a link to the original issue won't be created.

If editing the original link breaks the link creation while cloning an issue, it shouldn't be possible to edit the original config.
h3. Customer Impact

h3. Environment
*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Cog > Issues > Issue linking
# Click on Edit near to Cloners and change it to Clone (for example)
# Click on Save
# Try to clone any issue

h3. Expected Results
A clone should be created with a link to the original issue

h3. Actual Results
A clone is created but there is a message informing that the link to the original issue won't be created.

{code}The clone link type "Cloners" does not exist. A link to the original issue will not be created.{code}

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
The Workaround described for Cloud instances here: [The Clone Link Type 'Cloners' Does Not Exist Due to Missing Property |https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/The+Clone+Link+Type+%27Cloners%27+Does+Not+Exist+Due+to+Missing+Property]
fields.summary: Editing the link name "Cloners" prevent link creation while cloning issues

fields.description:
h3. Summary:

In the new Pop-up issue detail view, when you copy/paste an URL as a comment in the issue it returns an error message and comment is not added.

 
h3. Steps to reproduce:
 # login to jira 
 # open any board > active sprint
 # click on a ticket to open preview pop up
 # click at comment section
 # add URL as comment e.g. [https://google.|https://google.de/]com --> please type manually
 # click save button
 # copy the URL
 # add the URL as comment again
 # click save button

 
h3. Expected:

The Url should be added as a comment

 
h3. Actual Results:

An error is returned:

Your comment contains too much text or has been left empty. Review the content and try again. (Check video [^Bug.mp4])

 
h3. Workaround:

Deactivate the Lab *Issue Detail View* in the profile.
Paste the link using the unformatted paste (Cmd + Shift + V for Mac or Windows key + Shift + V for Windows).
fields.summary: Bug copying/Pasting URL in the new Issue Detail View

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The new JIRA look-and-feel has a problem with CSS styling for bullet points (UL/LI elements), which is problematic for us because our issue description authoring standards rely on bullet points, often having hundreds of bullet items per issue


h3. Environment
* New JIRA experience (ADG3)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* create a JIRA issue with nested bullet points in the description
* using browser developer tools, turn off the two style rules in the CSS snippet above
* enable those style rules

h3. Expected Results
* List items properly.

h3. Actual Results
* Bullets breaking.


h3. Notes
* The new UI uses 40px left margins for each UL level, which significantly reduces the amount of content that will fit on one line, making every issue longer to read and requiring more scrolling. 
* Different bullet point levels no longer have unique icons (filled circle for first level, hollow circle for next level, filled square for next level, etc.) which makes it harder to differentiate different levels of bullet points. 


h3.Workaround
No Workaround
fields.summary: Bullet Point styling broken in new JIRA UI

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a non admin user (but project administrator role) user edit the description or add an avatar and save it, the value defined on the Project Category changes to None. 

h3. Environment
Cloud - Jira 44753d77

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Project Category
# Create a projectA with category
# Assign userA as Project Admin in projectA
# Login as userA and update URL for projectA

h3. Expected Results
The project category value will not change and the edited description will be saved.

h3. Actual Results
Project Category is cleared (None) causing missing data and the edited description will be saved.

h3. Notes
* Same problem as this bug from Server https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-62989

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: Project category value changes to 'None' when editing project details

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – July 30, 2021    }
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your continued support and patience as we are making progress on the cloud-to-cloud migration release as part of the early access program.

Today I am happy to share that we have invited the final batch of customers for the early access program. During this phase we selected customers who are looking to move between instances over the month of August.

If you want to participate in the program, please reach out to the support team.

During Phase 2 of the program, we were able to identify 14 more bugs. We truly appreciate all the EAP participants who tried the product and gave their valuable feedback.

As a final piece, we will be sharing a short survey to get further feedback about your experience with the tool and how we can improve it further.

Best wishes,
Ritesh Ranjan
Product Manager, Migrations

 
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update – March 11, 2021}
Hi everyone,

I want to share some exciting news about the early access program for Jira cloud-to-cloud migration feature that we have been working on.

We’ve been working to build a simple path for migrating projects between cloud sites within the same organization, and today I am happy to announce an early access program for Jira Cloud-to-Cloud Migration, a new feature within Jira. The goal of the program is to test real-world data migration and to get feedback from your experience, thereby helping us build a robust product before we offer the capability more broadly.

You can read more about the program at [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Atlassian-Cloud-Migration/Jira-Cloud-to-Cloud-Migration-is-here-Get-early-access/ba-p/1635678] 

You can signup at  [https://surveys.atlassian.com/jfe/form/SV_6SAs9OX0eAbGk5f]

Thank you for your patience in this journey. Your interest and comments on this ticket has helped shape this. I look forward to speaking with you as we get closer to making this feature live with the early access program .

Cheers,
 Ritesh Ranjan
 Product Manager, Atlassian Cloud Migrations

 
{panel}
Through working with JIRA Cloud support, I learned that the only way to move a project from one instance to another, is to create a full backup, and import into the new instance. Then delete all of the projects in the new instance that did not need to transfer. 

We use JIRA and Confluence for managing many different projects. Some of them have thousands of Issues, and some have been in use for over 10 years. When our support efforts were for a project that wanted to migrate to its own instance, we were stuck in a 2 month process of figuring out how to make that happen. 

There should be more convenient functionality to move a project (Jira, Confluence, and any add-ons) between two cloud instances.
fields.summary: Ability to move Single Project to New Instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Currently, when users add multiple attachments while creating an issue. It will only take the latest attachment. For example, if there are *Attachment 1* and *Attachment 2*, when the issue is created, it'll consist of 2 *Attachments 2*. It only affects when the attachments are added by screenshot (Copy and Paste). For example, Snipping Tool for Windows.
*  !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!  

h3. Steps to Replicate
 # Create an issue.
 # Attach multiple attachments.
 # Create the issue
 # It'll only use the newest attached image.

h3. Expected Result

It'll create the issue with the proper attachments.

h3. Current Result

It is only taking the newest attached image.

  !screenshot-2.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
# Save the attachments with different names and upload it via the *Attachments* field. Then attached it to the *description* field.
# Create the issue first, then only paste the attachments in *description* field.
fields.summary: Pasting multiple attachments from clipboard will only appear as the latest attachment in the description field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In the new JIRA Board look and feel, file attachment preview is not working and load indefinitely, and an error is thrown in the console

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload a file (e.g. a pdf file) to a ticket in the Board
# Click on the file to preview it

h3. Expected Results
File preview appears

h3. Actual Results
The preview loads indefinitely, and the following error appear in console:
{code}
Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'pdf-config' of undefined
    at ModuleStore._backend (com.atlassian.jira.jira-fileviewer-plugin:atlassian-fileviewer.js?locale=en-US:443)
    at ModuleStore.get (com.atlassian.jira.jira-fileviewer-plugin:atlassian-fileviewer.js?locale=en-US:3209)
    at pdfViewProvider (com.atlassian.jira.jira-fileviewer-plugin:atlassian-fileviewer.js?locale=en-US:3665)
    at Commands.LookupViewer.execute (com.atlassian.jira.jira-fileviewer-plugin:atlassian-fileviewer.js?locale=en-US:733)
    at Object.<anonymous> (batch.js:79)
    at j (batch.js:76)
    at Object.add [as done] (batch.js:76)
    at Array.<anonymous> (batch.js:79)
    at Function.each (batch.js:69)
    at Object.<anonymous> (batch.js:78)
{code}
 
h3. Notes
The preview works fine in Issue View, but not in the Board

To preview the attachment, open it in Issue View mode.

fields.description:
h2. Summary
When importing into JIRA Cloud, the migration will not import site-admins users from source site if they already exist in the target instance, except for the user that ran the import and the user that owns the instance. The error message shown in UI:
{noformat} 
Could not remove the following users from site-admins group : user@example.com, site-admin@example.com
{noformat}

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Import into an empty JIRA Cloud instance with *site-admin* in the XML file.
# Once it is imported, import the same XML again into the same instance, containing the same *site-admins*.
# The users that are in *site-admin* group are removed from *User Management*.

h2. Expected Result
site-admins users from the source site are created but not added to the site-admins group.
Only site-admins after the migration are:
* site-admin user that performed the import
* 'admin' user that created the site (pending verification from identity team)

h2. Current Result
site-admins users from the source site are not created.
Only site-admins after the migration are:
* site-admin user that performed the import
* 'admin' user that created the site.

note: site-admin users are migrated into the Internal Directory (inactive) but not in the active one used by JIRA.

h2. Workaround
Remove all users from *site-admin* group except the one who is going to run the import from the target site and perform the import.
fields.summary: Importing to JIRA Cloud will remove users that are in site-admin group

fields.description:
h3. Summary

'Filter Picker' search can't find filters contain '-' (hyphen) in the filter name.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud ([new Jira experience|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/introducing-your-new-jira-experience-937886012.html])
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a filter with a hyphen in the name (e.g., *_Foo - Bar_*)
 # Go to 'Manage Filters' and search for the filter name *_Foo - Bar_*. Search result returns the filter as expected.
 !Search for filter in Manage Filters.png|thumbnail!
 # Go to any dashboard in edit mode.
 # Add 'Two Dimensional Filter Statistics' gadget
 # In the gadget config, search for *_Foo - Bar_*, it will return _No Matches_.
 # Click on 'Advanced Search' option so that it will open 'Filter Picker' window.
 # Search for the filter name *_Foo - Bar_*.
 !Filter Picker.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes:

No search results found when tried to search for the filter name from any agile board settings page when tried to update the board _Saved Filter_.
h3. Expected Results

Search should return the filter.
h3. Actual Results

Search returns _'Your search criteria did not match any filters'_.
 !Filter Picker.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround
# Rename the filter by removing '-' (hyphen).
# Add 'Foo - Bar' to favorite filters. Refer: [Adding a filter as a favorite|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/saving-your-search-as-a-filter-764478344.html#Savingyoursearchasafilter-favorite_filters].
# Select the filter from 'Favorites' tab in the 'Filter Picker' window.
# If you are trying to update the board filter from board settings page under _Saved filter_, search only for the filter name until '-'  (i.e., 'Foo -') and select the filter from the dropdown
fields.summary: 'Filter Picker' can't find filters contain '-' (hyphen) in the filter name.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While creating linked issues, new attachments cannot be added through the attachment button in the description field if profile language is set to languages other than English (UK) or English (United States).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set profile language to eg: русский (Россия)
# In any issue view, click on (...) > Create linked issues
# Scroll the description field. Click on the attachment button

h3. Expected Results
*+ Browse* button to add new attachment is displayed.
h3. Actual Results
*+ Browse* button to add new attachment is not displayed.
 
h3. Notes
If an attachment does not exist, the attachment button (paper clip icon) would not be displayed in the description field.
If an attachment exist from the linked issue, the button is displayed but clicking on it would not allow adding new attachments as the + Browse option is not enabled.

h3.Workaround
Add an attachment first then select to attach the attachment to the description.
fields.summary: Add attachment button in Description does not allow to add new attachments in languages other than English

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the assign issue dialog does not have the attachment insert button if there are no attachments in the issue. If there are attachments in the issue, users would not be able to add new attachments and could only select attachments which are already on the issue.
h3. Suggested Solution
Add the attachment insert button with the capability to add new attachments to the issue.
h3. Why this is important
 Simplify actions by using one dialog, a user can assign, add comments with attachments and also reduces the number of email notification to the affected users.
h3. Workaround 
Add the attachment to the issue first, then assign the issue.
fields.summary: Add the attachment insert button to the Assign issue dialog
Access to instance once Licences are finished

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, the Sub-task section in parent issues does not show the issue key of the sub-tasks. This makes it difficult to distinguish among sub-tasks.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to see the sub-tasks issue keys; possibly making it appear as a fly-over.
fields.summary: Include Issue Key in the Sub-task section of Parent issues

fields.description:
*Background:*

We currently use sub-tasks (of parent of a story or issue) to manage our Kanban board.

The allows us  to assign sub-tasks to different people, while maintaining all the sub-tasks associated to the parent task.

In some cases, we can have up 10 minor tasks.

 

*Problem:*

When we move the parent and sub-tasks to the "ready to work" column, other parent tasks appear to get lost in the list. 

This is because we are using cards to represent each parent and sub-tasks which takes a lot of space in the "ready to work" column.

 

*Suggestion*:

Could you please add a button or icon to parent tasks with sub-tasks so that we can collapse the sub-tasks below it?

When a user clicks on this button the sub-tasks listed below the parent task are hidden and the state of the button or icon used to collapse the sub-tasks changes so that you know the sub-tasks are in collapsed mode.

This would be very useful to our team and I'm sure others.

By the way, we know we can filter by parent issue. 

However, we would like something that it is intuitive and baked into your application.

 

Thank you.

Rene Ramos

rene@getwrecked.com
fields.summary: Kanban Board - Ability to collapse Sub-Tasks under Parent Issue

fields.description: Users would like to be able to bulk update profile information of JIRA an Confluence users. This includes being able to bulk update their profile pictures.
fields.summary: Bulk update User profile (Profile pictures included)

fields.description: Currently, CSV export of issues exports all fields including custom fields as *custom field (fieldname)*. It should give users the option to change field names before exporting the data.
fields.summary: CSV Export give option to rename fields
JIRA Cloud Docs recommending upgrading JIRA Server before migrating - this is not required

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Links with special characters are not correctly encoded.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a URL with any special characters like quotes or brackets.
 # Try to paste this URL on an issue description or comment.

h3. Expected Results

The URL is correctly encoded.
h3. Actual Results

The URL is encoded until the first special character, like *\{ }*, *[ ]* or *" "*
h3.  
h3. Workaround

Manually encode the characters:
{code:java}
{ = %7B
} = %7D
[ = %5B
] = %5D
" = "
{code}
fields.summary: URLs with special characters are not correctly encoded

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When we have Workflows that are part of Workflow Schemes with multiple Workflows, setting workflow properties may not work, as Jira is, for some reason, checked the *wrong* workflow for properties. 

As an example, if a Workflow Scheme has the 'workflow All' for all 'Unassigned Types' and 'workflow Bug' for Bug type, if we add a property for status 'Open' in 'workflow Bug', it may not affect a 'bug' in Open status, as Jira is checking for properties in 'workflow All', even though it should be checking in 2.

Similarly, if we have a property in 'workflow All' for status Open, it may take effect to a Bug, even though it shouldn't, as Bugs are not using that Workflow.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project with 2 Workflows
#* As an example, the first workflow defined is associated with the Bug type and the second to the Task type
# Create a property in the Task Workflow (say, remove 'edit' permission) and another in Bug Workflow (say, remove 'assign permissions to the same status)
# Create a Task ticket and make sure it's on the status with the properties


h3. Expected Results
The property in Task Workflow will take effect (for example, the ticket will not be editable)

h3. Actual Results
The property in Bug Workflow will take effect (for example, it won't be assignable). Also, if no property or that status doesn't exist in Bug Workflow, the property in Task Workflow won't take effect.

h3. Notes
* We can't replicate this in all scenarios. It seems that the order of the workflows impacts this behavior.

h3. Workaround

No workarounds at the moment.
fields.summary: Workflow status properties are not working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Project admins without JIRA Administration permission are not able to see the Issue Type configuration for the project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Login as a project admin without JIRA Admin access
# Access project configuration

h3. Expected Results
Issue Type configuration displayed along with other project permissions.
h3. Actual Results
Issue Type configuration does not appear in the project configuration.

h3.Workaround
The project admin still has access to the Issue Type Configuration through a direct link or through project Summary page, then click on the Issue Type scheme.
fields.summary: Project Issue Type configuration does not display for project admins without JIRA Administrator permission

fields.description:
Hi folks,

Please direct this to the Product Manager in charge of the new JIRA interface rollout.

I have two major beefs.

The first, the new interface is incredibly slow, to the point where I'm getting frustrated by how long it takes for software to load.  I profiled it myself and it takes 8 seconds to load my backlog page. This is unacceptable.

Second, I find the new checkbox filters to be incredibly difficult to use during sprint planning when I want to go through a set of filters with each filter corresponding to a team member as I have a bunch of extra clicks I need to do.

Thanks!
fields.summary: The new JIRA interface is slow and has poor UX

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When uploading utilizing Safari of multiple attachments to an issue an error of:
},"timeout":0,"xsrfCookieName":"XSRF-TOKEN","xsrfHeaderName":"X-XSRF-TOKEN","maxContentLength":-1,"headers"\{"Accept":"application/json, text/plain, */*","Authorization":"Bearer

Environment

Can only replicate in JIRA Cloud with Safari.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an issue in JIRA Cloud
 # After issue creation click "Browse": [https://screencast.com/t/yXXVOhvI] then multiple attachments

h3. Expected Results

Attachments are added to issue.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the the UI, attachments are not added:
 "timeout":0,"xsrfCookieName":"XSRF-TOKEN","xsrfHeaderName":"X-XSRF-TOKEN","maxContentLength":-1,"headers"\{"Accept":"application/json, text/plain, */*","Authorization":"Bearer

Workaround

Clicking on "Edit" issue and adding attachments through this screen, or lower the amount of attachments.

fields.description:
The issue display screen has this layout:
 * Summary
 * Button bar
 * All kinds of details about issue (type, status, epic link, etc.)
 * Description

However during refinement we have to scrol between summary and description. The details in between are most of time not relevant during refinement. Therefore we suggest a toggle button (+ keyboard shortcut) to hide/unhide these details. See screenshot for more details.

 

*DoD*
 * In issue display screen it is possible to hide/unhide issue details using a button or keyboard shortcut
fields.summary: Toggle to hide issue details in display screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

As per [Search Syntax|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/search-syntax-for-text-fields-765593720.html] documentation on for Cloud, term boosting (^} will be ignored on JQL searches. When using the caret on a JQL search, the search fails with error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Do a JQL search for a text with caret sign.

summary ~ "^"
summary ~ "test ^"

h3. Expected Results

Results should be returned accordingly.

h3. Actual Results

The search fails with the error : {{Unable to parse the text 'test ^' for field 'summary'.}}
fields.summary: Search with caret sign fails with error

h4. Summary:
In the New Jira Experience, all projects are displayed in the Projects Tab, even though users do not have permissions to access it.

h4. How to reproduce:
 # Create a permission scheme that does not give permission to any user (Archive project's scheme).
!Screen Shot 2017-10-18 at 10.56.15 AM.png|thumbnail!  
 # Associate projects with it
 # Go to the Projects tab in the New Jira experience

h5. Expected Result:
 * Only projects that the user should have permissions to view are displayed
!Screen Shot 2017-10-18 at 10.55.53 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Actual Results:
 * All projects are displayed.
 !Screen Shot 2017-10-18 at 10.56.37 AM.png|thumbnail!

Note: Even though the projects are displayed, if the user tries to access it he won't be able to, which confirms that the permissions are working as expected.
  !Screen Shot 2017-10-18 at 10.58.08 AM.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On certain JQL queries, [reserve words|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/search-syntax-for-text-fields-765593720.html] are causing the search to return an error instead of just ignoring the word.


h3. Steps to Reproduce

Perform a JQL query for the following
|summary ~ "THE"|
|summary ~ "BE" and status = Open|
|project = test and text ~ "BE"|
|project = test and text ~ 'THE test '|

h3. Expected Results

The reserved words should be ignored

h3. Actual Results

|summary ~ "THE"| Ignored|
|summary ~ "BE" and status = Open| Error : Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again.|
|project = test and text ~ "BE"|Error : Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again.|
|project = test and text ~ 'THE test '| Ignored|
fields.summary: Reserve words causing error on JQL search

fields.description:
I am the product manager for Backbone Issue Sync for JIRA (https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.k15t.backbone.backbone-issue-sync/cloud/overview). We are currently in the process of releasing our real Jira Cloud to Jira Cloud Sync.
At Summit, I talked to Dave Meyer, that we are missing a REST API in order to resolve the workflowscheme and all workflows for a given project. I know that there are these internal REST APIs which fulfill our needs:
* JIRA_BASE_URL/rest/projectconfig/1/workflowscheme/PROJECT_KEY
This returns the workflowscheme for a given project.
* JIRA_BASE_URL/rest/projectconfig/1/workflow?workflowName=WORKFLOW_NAME&projectKey=PROJECT_KEY
This returns all the details about the workflow with the given name and for the given project.
* JIRA_BASE_URL/rest/workflowDesigner/latest/workflows?workflowName=WORKFLOW_NAME&projectKey=PROJECT_KEY
This returns all the details about the workflow with the given name and for the given project. I think this one returned more information.

But they are not accessible in the Cloud environment with a JWT token, only with HTTP Basic auth since they are not official.
fields.summary: Whitelist Workflow Rest API

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The Billing page of some Atlassian Cloud instances are failing to load. Pulling up the page is producing 500 errors in the browser console, and is currently reproducible in all browsers.

h3. Environment
* Tested in Chrome, Safari, Firefox. Reports of this issue occurring in IE as well.
* Tested in cache/cookie-free environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to the Site Administration Page of an affected instance
# Click on Billing
# Click on Overview or Payment details or Bill Estimate, etc

h3. Expected Results
* Proper display of Billing details, as well as the options to make changes

h3. Actual Results
* A stuck loading screen, and 500 errors within the console

h3. Notes
* It’s worth noting that the Billing History section of each instance still pulls up data correctly
fields.summary: Billing section of Site Administration stuck loading

fields.description:
It would be very useful to allow for users with Confluence application access to be able to create JIRA issues through email in JIRA Core/Software, especially if "anonymous issue submission" is enabled.

This would allow Confluence users to still contribute JIRA tickets, without the need/ability to actively work on them.
fields.summary: Enable Confluence users to create JIRA issues through email if Anonymous is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary
While browsing through JIRA, in the below version and the environments tested, when the thread reaches a specific amount of memory, the tab is crashed and is necessary to refresh the page. Please, note that *the steps for replication are just one way to do this* there are many ways to reach this state, by simply browsing throughout the system.

Check uploaded video reproducing the error  [^Crash.mp4] 

h3. Environment

* Chrome Version 61.0.3163.100 
* Tested in Linux 
* Cases were reported  using Windows 7, but harder to reproduce.

h3. Steps to Reproduce (merely one way, but there are other ways reported)
# Go to a board containing a good number of issues (around 16)
# Click issue by issue to see the detailed view
# Repeat until it crashes (around 16 times for my case)

h3. Expected Results
Jira operates normally and stable

h3. Actual Results
Aw, Snap! Error message occurs
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 


 h3.Workaround
Not happening when using *Firefox*.

h3. Notes
Also checked in Chrome to 62.0.323.62
fields.summary: Specific Chrome version crashing

It would be nice to have the option to delete or hide fields related to applications that are no longer active.
fields.summary: Hide or remove system fields related to applications that were deactivated.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The search is not working if the dashboard has a composite name i.e: {{foo - bar}}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new dashboard where the name has spaces, for instance, *{{foo - bar}}*
 # Share this board with anyone, or with a specific group.
 # Logged as another user, try to search the dashboard.

h3. Expected Results

The mentioned dashboard is displayed on the search.
 !expected-result.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

The dashboard cannot be found.
 !no-results.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * Searching for a single term of the dashboard name return results, for instance, *foo* only, or *bar* only:
 !search-ok1.png|thumbnail! 
 !search-ok2.png|thumbnail!
 * The dashboard does not need to have a dash on the name. The problem is also reproducible with a simple space in the name - *foo bar*

h3. Workaround

Search for a part of the dashboard name, or search for the dashboard owner.
fields.summary: Dashboards with multiple names cannot be found on the search

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
# Open Issue Navigator
# Have some issues that were assigned to user within 24 hours
# Key in {{assignee was currentUser() after -1d}}

*Expected Result:*
- Only return issues that were assigned to the user within 24 hours from the current Date

*Current Result:*
- It returns all older issues that was once assigned to the user, regardless when was it assigned (including those already unassigned issues).
For example, issue might have been assigned to the user in last year and after that issue was unassigned in last year, but it will still be returned in the result
fields.summary: JQL operator "WAS" does not work when combining with operator "AFTER"

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Issues recently created on a business board are not displayed in 'Done' column

Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Business project
 # Add more than 1000 issues to this project. (For example 1500)
 # Move more or less 950 issues to 'Done' status
 # Go to the business board. The first 1000 issues were added to the board (according to the limit of 1000 issues per board)
 # Create a new issue at the bottom of the board
 # Move this new issue to 'Done' status

h3. Expected Results

The newest issue should be displayed on the board
h3. Actual Results

The newest issue is not displayed on the board
  
h3. Notes

In the [Business board documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/working-with-boards-800712866.html] we can read:

* By default, items are listed in the order of oldest to newest by creation date.
* Issues disappear from the last column after 14 days of inactivity. Select the link at the bottom of this column to see them again.

None of the functionalities described above are working

h3. Workaround

None at the moment
fields.summary: Business board filter only list the first 1000 issues ordered by created date in 'Done' column

fields.description:
We have run into weird race conditions when multiple users are editing the same issue.

For example:
 # User 1 opens the Edit Issue dialog
 # User 1 changes field A, leaving field B blank
 # User 2 opens the Edit Issue dialog and changes field B
 # User 2 presses Update
 # User 1 presses Update

The behavior we see is that field B will be reverted to a blank value, because User 1 did not have a value for field B when the Edit Issue dialog was initially opened.

It seems like there could be two main approaches to improve this scenario:
h1. Option 1 - Merge Changes

If the user does not change a field in the Edit Issue window, don't update that field.

This would require knowing if a user changed the field, as there are legitimate cases to change a field from a value back to blank.
h1. Option 2 - Save ID/Locking

Implement some sort of concurrency scheme that better handles multiple users working on the same issue.  A few ideas include:
 * Implement a "save id" concept, where you must get a unique token and return it when making change.  If you do not have the latest token, you get an error and have to reconcile the changes and submit again
 * Provide the ability to "lock" an issue and when the Edit window is open, other users cannot make changes.

It seems like Option 1 could be implemented in a non-breaking way and would improve most cases like this.  Option 2 would likely be a breaking change to the APIs, but would provide much more control over how cases like this are handled.
fields.summary: Improve behavior when multiple users edit same issue at same time

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The share issue dialog disappears when you scroll down the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a Jira issue and click on 'Share this issue' button:
!share-section.png|thumbnail! 
# Add enough users in a way to make the 'Share' button to render outside the window frame.
# Alternatively, you can resize the window or use a lower resolution. In both cases, the problem is reproducible.

h3. Expected Results
Scrolling down shouldn't break the Share dialog.

h3. Actual Results
The share dialog disappears, therefore you cannot click on 'Share' button.
 
h3. Notes
- The problem occurs on Chrome and Firefox.
- Here's a recording of the behavior to better understand the problem:
 [^share-dialog-breaking.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
None
fields.summary: The 'Share issue' dialog disappear when you scroll down the page

fields.description:
When associating a new Workflow Scheme to a project in JIRA Cloud, the user is prompted to map issue statuses if there is no direct mapping from the old Workflow Scheme to the new one.

*Expected Result**:* Only the issue types actually represented in the project being changed are shown in the list of mappings that need to be updated.

*Actual Result:* Every issue type in the entire JIRA installation (all projects) is presented for status mapping.

This is a very arduous and unnecessary process for large JIRA installs with tens or even hundreds of issue types across all projects. The mapping only needs to take place for issues that actually exist in the project being updated.
fields.summary: Only Update Associations for Issue Types in Project When Changing Workflow Scheme

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

If it doesn't already exist, a JIRA default resolution, such as 'Won't Do' or 'Can’t Reproduce', will be automatically recreated whenever a project is created, unless we use the option 'Create with shared configuration' to use the same workflow used by an existing project.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to stop the recreation of default resolutions whenever a new project is created.
fields.summary: Ability to stop the recreation of default resolutions whenever a new project is created

fields.description:
h3. Problem Description

JIRA Core board only have a limited Quick Filter and there is no way to customize that.

h3. Suggested Resolution

Provide a feature to customize Quick Filter in JIRA Core board.
fields.summary: Quick Filter for JIRA Core board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the new Jira experience, the section to create a new release is at the bottom of the page. In order to create a new release, you must scroll down to the bottom of the page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Switch back to the top.

h3. Why this is important
If the project has too many releases, it's counter-intuitive scroll down passing through every release to create a new one.

- Old layout:
!old-experience.png|thumbnail!

- New layout:
!new-experience.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround 
None.
fields.summary: Switch back the 'new release' section to the top of the page.

fields.description:

h3. Expected Results
* File uploaded to issue edit screen

h3. Actual Results
* "An internal error has occurred. Please contact your administrator."
* Jira application logs show 400 error when trying to upload a file via a new tab:

{noformat}
* Jira SRE has tested this issue
Upload within the same browser tab: Successful
{noformat}
https://czawadka-attachements-addon.atlassian.net/rest/internal/2/AttachTemporaryFile
	?filename=upload.png
	&size=111377
	&atl_token=BRUV-CDXI-MJWM-HQHA%7C399bc91f58b2870bc0a66d3e19d2a57ea4f064c6%7Clin
	&formToken=ef903e94d1d47504215dd5afefa09cfb19238955
	&issueId=10012
{noformat}

{noformat}

	?filename=upload.png
	&size=111377
	&atl_token=BRUV-CDXI-MJWM-HQHA%7C399bc91f58b2870bc0a66d3e19d2a57ea4f064c6%7Clin

{noformat}

h3.Workaround
* No known workarounds

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Searching for an equal sign using the contains operator does not work.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Create a JIRA Issue with the summary : {{Test = test}}
 - Search for the equal sign using the Advanced or Basic search. : {{summary ~ '='}}

h3. Expected Results

The JIRA issues containing the equal sign in the summary should be displayed in the results.
h3. Actual Results

Basic Search : {{=}}
 Results : No results

Advance Search
|Query|Results|
|Summary ~ '='|No results|
|Project=XX and Summary ~ '='|No results|

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User wants the ability to edit the content of the get local help function to configure the details within the local help suiting more towards the projects being displayed in the JIRA application, therefore the potential change in information visible to the users when hovering over the get local help buttons. 
h3. Expected Results

To be able to edit and configure the content of the Get Local Help to be personalized to the projects and content of the instance. 
h3. Actual Results

The Get Local Help is default with fixed locations and fixed information which applies to the general data which can lead to confusion if some data is changed. 

 
h3.
fields.summary: Ability to Edit The Get Local Help Option In JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

We would like specific users to be able to only view the issue queues without giving them a JIRA license and without making the issues publicly available.

h3. Suggested Solution

Make it possible to have read-only users that don't count towards the licenses.
fields.summary: Ability to create read-only users that don't count towards the licenses

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Issues are appearing on boards of business projects with due date -1 on the JIRA Mobile app.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a business project.
# Add issues with any due date.
# Go to the project board and check the due date.

h3. Expected Results
E.g: If the issue is created with the due date configured to be today it should show on the board as today "label".


h3. Actual Results
Issue is appearing with Yesterday "label".
fields.summary: Mobile app shows due date as off by one

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The priority color isn't updated in the 'View Priorities' page using the New JIRA Experience.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Priorities
# Edit a priority color
# Navigate back to 'View Priorities' page
If you click to edit the priority again, in the 'Edit priority' page the previously set color will be shown instead of the default.

h3. Expected Results
The priority should show the newly updated color

h3. Actual Results
The default color is shown
 
h3. Workaround
Switch back to old JIRA Experience.

(!) Please note that the color is actually updated since the selected color is properly shown in the gadgets.
fields.summary: Priority Color isn't updated in priorities settings using New JIRA Experience

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When .xar files (Xara graphics file) are being uploaded in any issues, some of them randomly are being saved as image/jpeg file format in database, while the others are being stored as binary/octet-stream. This is regardless of how the file is being uploaded, either drag and drop or using 'browse'. See !XAR Attachments.png|thumbnail!

This makes the .xar file which has been saved as image/jpeg, being displayed (previewed) as image thumbnail in the issue. And clicking on this file will display it as image in the browser. See !Preview XAR File.png|thumbnail! 
 While clicking on the .xar file which is saved as binary/octet-stream will download it.
h3. Steps to replicate
 # Go to any issue
 # Upload some .xar (Xara graphics file) files either by drag-drop or 'browse'

h3. Expected Results

The file being thumbnailed as binary file (similar thumbnail as text file) and clicking on that result to downloading it
h3. Actual Results

The file is being thumbnailed as image/jpeg file and clicking on that result to preview it as image in the browser
h3. Workaround

When in the preview mode, use _download_ functionality in the top right of the page to download the file.
fields.summary: Uploading .xar file (Xara graphics file) in issue will randomly be stored as image/jpeg in database

fields.description:
When creating a project with shared configuration in the 'new JIRA experience' there is a dropdown list where you select which project you´d want to share the configuration with.

To simplify the selection a typeahead field would be preferred, so that you don´t have to scroll through so many items.
fields.summary: typeahead instead of dropdown in shared configuration selection

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The operator 'changed' is not supporting fields in JIRA Cloud JQL (For example: 'status', 'assignee' fields)

h3. How to replicate
 # Go to JIRA
 # Go to JIRA Issue Navigator
 # Click on *Advanced* search
 # Paste this {{status changed DURING (-1, now())}}

h3. Actual Result

This error message will appear {{The operator 'changed' is not supported by the '...' field.}}

h3. Expected Result

It will show you some result.

h3. Workaround
This is the temporary workaround if the filter is used in the board and the board is not loading:
# From the top navigational menu, go to Issues > Manage Filters
# Find the filter that is used in the board and click on it
# Edit the JQL to remove the {{was}} and {{changed}}
# Save the JQL

h3. Note
Software boards are not loading the issues if the filter contains 'changed' or 'was'. After removing 'changed' or 'was', the issues will be loaded.
fields.summary: Recurring - The operator 'changed' and 'was' are not supporting fields in JIRA Cloud JQL

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Adding more attachments of the same name as the original causes their filenames so be appended with a strange and long string of characters.
h3. Expected Results

The attachments should have names like _<filename> (1).<ext>_, _<filename> (2).<ext>_, etc.

h3. Actual Results
The original filename remains at _<filename>.<ext>_; the subsequent ones have names like _<filename> (xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx).<ext>_, where the *x*es are hexadecimal digits. See screenshot below.

h3. Workaround
 * None

h3. Screenshot (showing the issue)
!image-2017-10-13-14-34-42-535.png!

h3. Note
Until this feature is implemented, it would be helpful if at least some sort of alert or pop-up is shown to the user to intimate that they are uploading duplicate-named files.
fields.summary: Attachments (of the same name) have a strange and long string of characters in their name

fields.description:
As part of JST-333129 I asked about how to display a user's permissions. I was told the best way is to use the "Log in as User" feature and then browse projects.

Honestly that's a bit ridiculous - as an admin I should easily be able to see what access any given user has.

So I'm suggesting it here. Thanks!

--Ren
fields.summary: User Administration UI should include a way to display permissions for a given user

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Unable to track time when creating issues on JIRA mobile

h3. Environment
 
* iOS 11.0.3

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure 'Time Tracking' field is showing on project's 'Create Issue' screen
# Create a new issue in JIRA using Mobile App
# On issue create screen, select 'Time Tracking'

h3. Expected Results

Log work window pops up allowing you to log time for tracking

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens

h3. Notes

If you edit an issue and click 'Time Tracking' field, it'll work properly.
This seems to only affect time tracking on 'Create Issue' screens

h3.Workaround

Create issue first with no time tracking
Edit issue afterwards and add time tracking
* This is not a viable workaround if 'Time Tracking' field is required
fields.summary: Unable to track time when creating issues on JIRA mobile

fields.description:
Our documentation [OAuth for REST APIs|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/jira-rest-api-oauth-authentication/] might be misleading when it tells customers to use *OauthKey* as the value for the {{Consumer Key}} field. Customers can misinterpret it as they may understand they can use the same value for this field for any other application link. However, by doing this it'll break all the application links that use that Consumer Key.

h3. Suggested Solution
Explicitly say that Consumer Keys must be unique for each Consumer.

Example: Consumer key = OauthKey (Please, note that consumer keys are unique for each consumer, meaning that you must not use the same Consumer Key for multiple consumers).
fields.summary: Update OAuth documentation on Consumer key information

fields.description:
When a ticket is being worked on there will be comments but also technical and testing notes. It becomes hard to find these technical and testing notes amongst all noise of the discussions going on under the 'comments' tab and often get missed because they are are 'concertina'. These need to be separated out into their own tabs. Perhaps new tabs called 'Technical details' and 'Testing notes'. These would be the same format as the 'comments' section but perhaps with no 'concertina' to expand/collapse.

!image-2017-10-12-15-28-11-580.png!
fields.summary: Create separate 'Technical details' and 'Testing notes' tabs under 'Activity' section

fields.description:
h3. Summary
As explained in [Configuring issue-level security|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-issue-level-security-776636711.html], the issue security can be done based on *A (multi-)user or (multi-)group picker custom field*.

Using it in case when the Custom field has value in the Story, but not in Subtask:
* When viewing the issue - Subtasks are *hidden* for users who have no permission. 
* On the board - Subtasks are *showing* for users who have no permission. 


h3. Environment
Jira 1000.1369.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create Custom field of type *Group picker*
#*  !Custom field.png|thumbnail! 
# Create Issue Security Scheme and add "Group custom field value" to previously created custom field
#*  !issue security.png|thumbnail! 
# Associate this Issue type scheme with the project
# Note that the subtask are hidden for users that don't have permission to see the subtasks in View Issue 

h3. Expected Results
Subtasks are not shown on board

h3. Actual Results
Subtasks are showing on board
 *  !subtasks on board.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
Tried adding a different *Visible to Group* for the subtasks as well but, it it still shown on the board.  

h3.Workaround
-
fields.summary: "Group custom field value" issue security not working for subtasks on the new issue view

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition

Security of JIRA content is very important for many of our customers and securing the login action is the first step to ensure valid authentication to protect confidential information. Currently, JIRA offers only email/username password combination is available.
h3. Suggested Solution

Two factors authentication can be adopted to add more security to JIRA login action.
 Many solutions are available, like *Gmail* approach for two factor:
 - SMS based, no new hardware needed
 - Can authorize a browser for up to 30 days from a single two factors auth (e.g. only pw is needed for 30 days, and on day 31 you have to do the whole two factors dance)
 Gmails approach is a nice combination of security and ease of use but others are available too.

h3. Plugins as workaround

There is 2 plugin offering this features
 # [2-Factor Auth (2FA) Secure Login - JIRA|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/de.syracom.jira.plugins.securelogin/overview]
fields.summary: Two Factor authorization, like Gmail has, for JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customer who are Transitioning Multiple issues at once (Bulk Operation) have noticed that the Bulk Operation Completes but no actions are made on the Issues.  If a Validator is on the Transition is not met, the Bulk Operation 'completes' without error however does not transition the issues. 

h3. Environment
* Cloud 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure a "Field has been modified Validator" on a Workflow Transition: eg Time Spent Field should be modified during the transition | Error Message: This field is required
# Publish workflow
# In Issue Navigator, attempt to Bulk Edit and Transition issues using the Workflow with a Validator

h3. Expected Results
If the Validator is not Met, display an error message

h3. Actual Results
Bulk Operation runs through and looks like it completes successfully. Issues that were Bulk Edited were not changed. 

In Jira logs; using the Time Spent example:
{noformat}  	 logger:	 com.atlassian.jira.workflow.validator.FieldRequiredValidator	
  	 message:	 Could not get time spent from the transition	{noformat}

h3. Notes
If an Issue is manually transitioned using the Transition Buttons and the Validator is not Met, an error is displayed
Time Spent/Log Work cannot be done in Bulk:
{noformat}N/A	Change Log Work	NOTE: This field is not available for bulk update operations.{noformat}

h3.Workaround
If using a Time Spent/Log Work Validator - Remove it from the Workflow Transition or Manually Transition the issue
If other Custom Fields, ensure that they are present on the Screen used in the Workflow Transition and are Populated during the Bulk Operation
fields.summary: Bulk Edit Transitions Fail Silently If Validator Is Not Met

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The following search throws an error:

example of affected searches:
{code}
due >= 2017-10-15
worklogDate = 2017-10-15
{code}
Date value '2017-10-15' for field 'due' is invalid. Valid formats include: 'YYYY/MM/DD', 'YYYY-MM-DD', or a period format e.g. '-5d', '4w 2d'.
h3. Customer Impact
h3. Environment
*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to Issues > Seach for issues
# use this query due >= 2017-10-15
h3. Expected Results
It should find issues with this due date or don't find any result if there isn't any. However, it shouldn't throw any error.
h3. Actual Results
It throws an error:
Date value '2017-10-15' for field 'due' is invalid. Valid formats include: 'YYYY/MM/DD', 'YYYY-MM-DD', or a period format e.g. '-5d', '4w 2d'.
*Application logs:*
h3. Notes
h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: Search with specific date 2017-10-15 throws an invalid date error

fields.description:
h2. Summary
While creating issue, it is not possible to paste a screenshot from clipboard.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Create issue
# Paste attachments from clipboard

h2. Expected Result
It should upload the attachments and display it on the description as thumbnail

h2. Current Result
It doesn't upload the attachments and the description shows that it can't render the image.

h2. Workaround
# Save the attachments and upload it via the *Attachments* field.
# Paste the attachments after issue creation.
fields.summary: Unable to paste attachments from clipboard while creating issue

fields.description:
Hello,

this is a feature request, as a spinoff of closed service desk issue:

[https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/23/JST-227786]

We are integrating Github with JIRA cloud. As we follow the Git Flow development model, we find ourselves rebasing our feature branches on the `develop` branch daily. The obsolete (and unreachable) commits still show on the Git integration section on the issue. This is confusing, especially if the number of commits is large, and if the number of rebases is also large, as I end up seeing dozens and dozens of commits, instead of the real, "reachable" commits.

I have used JIRA (on-premise) integrated with on-premise Stash, and I am quite sure that we never had this issue.

The support engineer I spoke with in the linked service desk issue adviced me to overcome this by forcing a complete syncing. This works, but this is merely a workaround, as I have to do this all the time.

I would suggest enhancing your Github integration by implementing the same behaviour you are already providing when integrating with Stash (and presumably Bitbucket as well). I believe that it greatly degrades the integration you are providing.
fields.summary: Jira/Github integration - deleted commits still show

fields.description:
h3. Summary

On a setup where 2 similar workflows are configured within the same workflow scheme, the property from one workflow is taking effect on issue types that are not assigned to that workflow.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 - Create a duplicate workflow (Workflow_1 and Workflow_2) containing *To Do, In Progress, Done* status.
 - Set up the following workflow scheme :
|Name|Issue Types|
|Workflow_1|Story, Epic, Tasks, All Unassigned Issue Types|
|Workflow_2|Bug, Sub-tasks|

 - Assign the workflow scheme to a project.
 - Edit the workflow property for *In Progress* status for Workflow_1.
 - Add the property *jira.permission.work.denied* and blank value (property to disable worklog on the workflow).
 - Try to use "Log Work" for a *Story* and try to use "Log Work" for a *Bug*.

h3. Expected Results

Log work should not be available for any issue type on *In progress* status except for Bug and sub-tasks.
h3. Actual Results

Log work is disabled for Bug and sub-tasks even if Workflow_2 has not property to disable it.
{code:java}
WORK_ON_ISSUES granted by permission scheme but DENIED by workflow
{code}
The workflow property that will take effect is the one from the workflow which is assigned to *All Unassigned Issue Types*.
fields.summary: Workflow property propagating to other issue type in the workflow scheme

fields.description:
h2. Summary
Using IE 11, clicking on the *+ Browse*  in *Description* field does not work, as it doesn't pop up the files to be attached.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Use IE 11
# Navigate to any screen that has *Description* field, click on the *Attachments* icon.
# On the drop down, click *+ Browse* 

h2. Expected Result
It should have a pop up to allow users to browse for files to be attached.

h2. Current Result
It doesn't pop up the files for the users to browse

h2. Workaround
* Use the *Attachments* field to browse for files instead of *Description* field.
* Use a different browser.
fields.summary: Can't browse for files for Description field in IE 11

fields.description:
h2. Summary
On create issue dialog when pasting screenshot (or file) from clipboard to description field only text that refers to an image is inserted but no actual file is attached to issue.

h2. Steps to Replicate
# Create issue
# Copy a file from your computer and paste it into the description field
# Click the "Create" button at the bottom of the form right after pasting the file

h2. Expected Result
It should upload the attachments and display it in the description as a thumbnail.
A warning message should be displayed if the user clicks on "Create" button before the attachment upload is completed, as it works when you drag-and-drop the image on the field. 

h2. Current Result
It doesn't upload the attachments and the description shows that it can't render the image:
{code}
Unable to render embedded object: File (image-2017-10-11-22-23-22-631.png) not found.
{code}

 [^Screen Recording 2018-07-10 at 04.40 PM.mov] 


h2. Workaround
# Save the attachments and upload it via the *Attachments* field. Then, it is possible to attach it to the *description* field
# Create the issue first, then only paste the attachment.
# Scroll down and check the progress bar be completed in the "Attachment" field
fields.summary: Copy/paste images on create issue dialog is not working
Issue Navigator should display the Remote Link

h2. Description

A broken image is displayed in the "Components" section of any Service Desk "Project Settings" page if there are no compoment available.
See screenshots below:
 !OldDesign.png|thumbnail! 

 !NewDesign.png|thumbnail! 

The broken link is:
<JIRA_BASE_URL>/download/resources/com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:components-page-assets-pre-adg3/page/project/components/components-blank-state.svg

h3. Environment

This issue is observed in any Service Desk project, on both the old and the new JIRA design.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Create a JIRA Service Desk project
- Go to Project Settings
- Click on "Components" from the left bar menu
- If there is any component, delete all of them

h3. Expected Results

There should be an image (or no image) instead of a broken image.

h3. Actual Results

There is a broken image.

h3. Workaround

To make the broken image disappear, create at least one component.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Mail handlers are creating duplicated comments. It seems like what happens is:

* JIRA processes email for more than 60s.
* while JIRA is still processing email, the connection drops (http 499 on nginx).
* JIRA finishes adding comment but cannot respond.
* The mail handler retries reading the mail box and the process repeats.

h3. Environment

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Send an email with attachments to a mail handler with the default timeout (1 min)

h3. Expected Results

The mail handler should process this email and add a comment to the issue

h3. Actual Results

The connection to the mail server closes before the handler is done processing the email. Therefore that email is not removed from the mail server and at the next run the handler will process the same email again, creating duplicated comments.
 
h3. Notes
Similar to this other bug, https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67475

h3. Workaround

Increase the delay configuration in the mail handler
fields.summary: Mail Handler creating duplicated comments

fields.description:

However, even though there's a button that helps us navigating across our different platforms documentation, not all knowledge is properly linked and sometimes we find ourselves being redirected to pages that do not contain the documentation expected.

The idea of this ticket is to reference any documentation that is not properly linked so that we can improve how our knowledge is presented.
